MODULE.name: NewORMModel
MODULE.MORE_HELP: New implementation of the RHOM Model. NOTE: BETA VERSION - This API has not been officially released. It should not be used in a production environment.

PROPERTY.DESC: This number determines the order in which the models are processed and synchronised. Priority starts from lower value 1. Lower the number, higher is the priority. Default value is 1000.

VALUE.DESC: This partition is used automatically if the model is not a sync model.

METHOD.name: findObjects
METHOD.DESC: Returns array of objects for the given model queried according to the specified conditions. It is applicable only for Fixed_schema Model.

PARAM.name: whatParam
PARAM.DESC: It defines the type of find operation to be performed.

VALUE.DESC: Finds all Objects matching the 'conditions' for a specific Model.
Returns the number of Objects matching the 'conditions' in a specific Model.
Returns the first Object matching the 'conditions' in a specific Model.

PARAM.name: strOptions
PARAM.DESC: This HASH takes only three key-value pairs for which the first key is `conditions` and the value is the attribute name. For multiple attribute names, OR/AND/IN operator is used. The second key is `offset` and the value is an integer which indicates the number of records to skip before returning. The third key is `per_page` and the value is an integer which specifies number of records to be returned.

PARAM.name: quests
PARAM.DESC: This Array takes the values as String for the attribute names passed in the "strOptions" parameter.

PARAM.name: selectAttrs
PARAM.DESC: This Array takes the attribute names as string.Useful if the model has many attributes and your query only needs a few of them.

PARAM.name: orderAttrs
PARAM.DESC: This Array is formed using attribute name followed by Order direction for that attribute. Order direction: 'ASC' ascending, 'DESC' descending. Default = 'ASC'.

METHOD.DESC: Initializes new model's instance.

METHOD.name: create
METHOD.DESC: Create a new Rhodes model object and save it to the database. This is the fastest way to insert a single item into the database.

PARAM.name: attrs
PARAM.DESC: List of attributes assigned to the new model object, such as {name : "ABC Inc.",address: "555 5th St."}.

METHOD.name: changed?
METHOD.DESC: Returns true if a Rhodes model object has local database changes that need to be synchronized, false otherwise.

METHOD.name: client_id
METHOD.DESC: Returns the current sync client id.

METHOD.DESC: Returns the number of objects in the named model.

METHOD.name: can_modify
METHOD.DESC: Checks whether the object can be modified.

METHOD.name: updateAttributes
METHOD.DESC: Updates the current Rho model object attributes and saves it to the database. This is the fastest way to add or update model attributes.

PARAM.name: attributes
PARAM.DESC: List of attributes and their updated values are passed as a key-value pair in this HASH.

METHOD.name: update_attributes
METHOD.DESC: Updates the current Rho model object attributes and saves it to the database. This is the fastest way to add or update model attributes.

PARAM.name: attributes
PARAM.DESC: List of attributes and their updated values are passed as a key-value pair in this HASH.

METHOD.name: paginate
METHOD.DESC: The paginate method takes care of setting the proper page limit and offset when a large number of records are fetched. This method accepts parameters as key-value pairs.

PARAM.name: params
PARAM.DESC: A hash-map with paginate arguments.

PARAM.name: page
PARAM.DESC: This value is an offset which indicates the prevailing page number.

PARAM.name: per_page
PARAM.DESC: This value specifies number of records to be returned. The default value of per_page is 10.

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: hash of attribute/values. Also supports sql fragment with binding(i.e. ["name=?", "company_name"]).

PARAM.name: order
PARAM.DESC: The attribute names to order the list.

PARAM.name: orderdir
PARAM.DESC: Order direction: 'ASC' ascending, 'DESC' descending. Default = 'ASC'.

PARAM.name: select
PARAM.DESC: The array of string attributes to return with the object.

METHOD.name: find_all
METHOD.DESC: find('all') replaces the legacy ruby method find_all.

METHOD.name: save

METHOD.name: deleteAll

PARAM.name: params
PARAM.DESC: A hash-map with deleteAll arguments.

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: The attribute names and its respective values are passed as a key-value pair in this HASH. This will delete only the objects matching the criteria passed in the HASH.

METHOD.name: has
METHOD.DESC: Returns true if the model has the propertyName given.

PARAM.name: propertyName
PARAM.DESC: The name of the property you are checking for its existence.

METHOD.name: vars
METHOD.DESC: Returns an object containing all propertyName and values for the model. You can use myModel.vars().name instead of myModel.get('name').

METHOD.name: get_source_id
METHOD.DESC: Returns the source id number for this Rhodes model object. Please use the model property source_id.

METHOD.name: get_source_name
METHOD.DESC: Returns the source name for this Rhodes model object. Please use the model property model_name.

METHOD.name: get
METHOD.DESC: Get the value of a property of the current model.Ex: myModel.get('name'); See also the vars() method.

PARAM.name: propertyName
PARAM.DESC: The name of the property you are trying to retrieve.

RETURN.DESC: Value of the specified property from the database.

METHOD.name: push_changes
METHOD.DESC: Pushes all changes for the source.

METHOD.name: delete_all
METHOD.DESC: Delete all Rhodes model objects for a source filtering by conditions. This method accepts parameters as key-value pairs. It accepts 2 keys- conditions and op.

PARAM.name: params

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: The attribute names and its respective values are passed as a key-value pair in this HASH. This will delete only the objects matching the criteria passed in the HASH.Also supports sql fragment with binding(i.e. ["name=?", "company_name"]
